chapter.title: Installation
chapter.para: This section describes how to install JBoss Messaging.

section.title: Prerequisites

para.note: JBoss Messaging only runs with Java 5 or later. We recommend Java 6 for the best performance.

section.para: By default, JBoss Messaging server is run with 1GB of memory. If your computer has less memory, modify the value in bin/run.sh accordingly.
Ant is required to build and run the examples.

section.title: Installing JBoss Messaging standalone
section.para: After downloading the distribution unzip it into your chosen directory. At this point it should be possible to run straight out of the box, the following describes the directory structure that should be seen
section.programlisting: |-- bin |-- config |-- lib |-- docs | |-- api | `-- userguide `-- examples

listitem.para: This contains the binaries and scripts needed to run JBM.
This contains configuration files needed to configure JBM. Refer to the configuration chapter for details on how to do this.
This contains jars needed to run JBM.
This contains this user guide and the JBM Javadocs..
This contains a set of examples. Refer to the 'running examples' chapter for details on how to run them.
